meanings.definition: The amount of content that fills one page.
meanings.sent1: I printed a pageful of pictures for my project.
meanings.sent2: The book was so interesting that I couldn't stop reading until I reached a pageful of information.
meanings.sent3: My printer ran out of ink halfway through, so I only got a pageful of the document.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a pageful of memories, each one carefully stored and cherished.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's whiteboard was a pageful of notes, diagrams, and equations, making it easy for students to follow along.

meanings.definition: A page that is full of content.
meanings.sent1: The magazine had a pageful of colorful illustrations that caught my eye.
meanings.sent2: I turned the page and found a pageful of text, making it hard to read without my glasses.
meanings.sent3: The notebook was so full that it was practically bursting with a pageful of notes and doodles.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room, filling it with a pageful of joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The website homepage was a pageful of links, images, and information, overwhelming visitors with choices.
